p: NPs can be prepared from both inorganic and organic materials [ 21, 22, 23], and currently, especially encapsulation to various biodegradable nature-based biopolymers is more and more frequently used [ 19, 20, 24, 25]. NPs can be generated by either top-down methods (dispergation, fluidization, homogenization processes, or emulsifying technologies) or bottom-up methods (precipitation/condensation processes, evaporation techniques, various controlled sol-gel syntheses) [ 21, 26]. NPs produced using mechanical approaches are usually, in the range 100–1000 nm; to produce NPs of size 10–100 nm, chemical and bottom-up methods are used [ 21, 27]. “Green” synthesis of NPs or innovative biotechnological approaches related to the synthesis of NPs are summarized by Singh and Shukla et al. [ 22, 23].
